intro: Seegeriella, commonly known as the false madder, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are typically herbaceous, with simple, alternate leaves that are often ribbed or veined. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. Seegeriella species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
